commits.commitMessage:
Remove reset on start

The ArduinoBridge app is now taking care of reseting
the Arduino.

comments.message:
Patch Set 2:

I have made it so that the ArduinoBridge resets the Arduino when it starts.  Perhaps this patch is no longer required as a result.

Abandoned

This was old and not up to date, but I guess the reset implementation that's currently in the app needs to be removed then.

commits.commitMessage:
Add arduino reset upon application start

Uses GPIO control to reset the Arduino before starting the control of relays.

Change-Id: Ie46ab0a3abd03bcd31bab291b87e204f552a1614
commits.subject: Add arduino reset upon application start

commits.commitMessage:
update Arduino Sketch & RelayControl App

Arduino Sketch:
AirVantage references need to be replaced by SwiBridge
RelayControl App:
dataRouter_SessionStart wasn't called in MainResponseHandler,
so UpdateHandler were not well registered.
RelayControl sdef:
Update with Mangoh.sdef

Resolves: MANGOH-6
Change-Id: Ica6a78956ebee1c0646735f612af46e7e38c7c14
commits.subject: update Arduino Sketch & RelayControl App

comments.message:
Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Patch 4 addresses 1/4 comments added to review of Patch 3
Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.

Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

Apologies for not addressing all your comments at first
Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.
Change has been successfully merged by David Frey
I think this pushes the wrong value.  10 - 2 == 8, but 2, 3,... 9, 10 is 9 items.

If you did `message.indexOf("\n") - 1` then you could use `current == ("|" KEY_SETSTATE_REQ)` below.  I think it would be a little clearer.  Also "RelayCountReqSomeGarbage\n" is accepted by the current code.

That is not the case, the format seems to be |key|value|timestamp\n
So == can't be used without asserting the content, which is not what I want.

You're right, makes more sense now.

At first I called parseString, and if it failed I would have to called it again with another parameter.
Now that it relies on startsWith I can use 'else if' indeed.

Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

oops, I missed something.  Adding a comment.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Add the message that is mentioned in my previous comment
Change has been successfully merged by David Frey
